snippet: Artisanal food trucks have been making inroads in Paris, adding a new twist in culinary culture to a city where diners rarely eat on the go, much less with their hands.
abstract: Artisanal food trucks have been making inroads in Paris, adding a new twist in culinary culture to a city where diners rarely eat on the go, much less with their hands; American food is suddenly being seen as more than just restauration rapide; among young Parisians, there is currently no greater praise for cuisine than 'tres Brooklyn,' a term that signifies a particularly cool combination of informality, creativity and quality.
lead_paragraph: Artisanal food trucks have been making inroads in Paris, adding a new twist in culinary culture to a city where diners rarely eat on the go, much less with their hands.

headline.seo: Food Trucks Add American Flavor to Paris
headline.main: Food Trucks in Paris? U.S. Cuisine Finds Open Minds, and Mouths
headline.print_headline: Food Trucks in Paris? U.S. Cuisine Finds Open Minds, and Mouths
